channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #80 - YAPC::NA opened registration. Perl Workshops in Israel, Germany, and Switzeland
item.description:
Hi,

this edition was mostly put together by Yanick, I just added a few entries.

YAPC::NA has finally opened its web site for registration. See the link at the bottom of this edition along with the links to three Perl workshops.

Enjoy your week!

item.title: Seeking 'list-owner' help
item.description: Not a coding ninja, but want to help the Perl ecosystem? The Perl NOC needs volunteers to be mailing list helping fairies and gnomes.

item.title: RT 4.0.10 Released
item.description: A new bugfix release of RT is out.

item.title: New documentation for RT
item.description: Documentation, lovely documention... The RT crew has been working at beefing up its documentation. Here's the fruit of their labor

item.title: CPAN uploads per month
item.description: A picture is worth a thousand words. Or, in this case, roughly a thousand new uploads to CPAN per month.

item.title: Core Perl documentation and CPAN module documentation
item.description: Gabor Szabo offers a refresher on how to access Perl documentation (both for core stuff and modules).

item.title: Let's talk about Graphite
item.description: Franck Cuny is using Graphite @{$work}, and is giving us a peek at how it fits in its surrounding environment.

item.title: QA Hackaton 2013 Laundry List
item.description: Ovid gives us a idea of the TODO list for the upcoming QA Hackaton. Prepare to drool.

item.title: Versioning Developer Releases
item.description: v1.1_1, is it considered to be higher than v1.1, or lower because a trial version? Chisel wasn't sure either, and found out.

item.title: more on the speed of file finding
item.description: Ricardo Signes follows up on his file finding modules performance tests of last week.

item.title: Test::Class::Moose on the CPAN
item.description: A new contender in the JUnit-type testing arena. This one is from Ovid, and throws Moose goodness in the mix.

item.title: Large gzipped files, long lines, extracting columns etc
item.description: So, you have those massive gzipped log files: how to plow through them in less than geological times? Sinan Unur tries to find out.

item.title: Lexing and Parsing Continued
item.description: Parsing DOT graph files using Marpa.

item.title: Pushing Your Code TODOs to GitHub Issues
item.description: Yanick presents a little script that magically turns all the TODOs in your code in GitHub issues (but, alas, don't fix them for you).

item.title: Fetching the status of blog entries using grep and cut
item.description: So, you left your blog entry directories 'grow organically', and now you want to tame the resulting unholy mess. Gabor Szabo shows us how he fought entropy with perl, grep, cut, and a good vacuum cleaner.

item.title: Goodbye Path::Class, hello Path::Tiny
item.description: Path::Class is awesome, but not the fastest horse in the stabble. Consequently, here comes David Golden's Path::Tiny, with 90% of its cousin's features and a lot more speed in its hooves.

item.title: Command history in the perl debugger
item.description: New perl installed. Fire up the debugger. Ah, yes, which modules do we need to get command history in there again? Chisel found out, and wrote a small puppet update to make sure everything needed is always there.

item.title: Planning a Content-Security-Policy with Dancer
item.description: Mike Doherty cares about security. He has a look at the Content Security Policy proposed by Mozilla, and shows how to write a simple CSP violation tracker using Dancer.

item.title: Citrus on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Mark Dootson provides fruitful information how to get Citrus Perl running on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Alien::Base Grant - Report #8
item.description: Joel Berger continues to toil on Alien::Base, and needs some help from CPANtesters.

item.title: Rakudo Star 2013.01 released
item.description: These Perl 6 decelopers unstoppable!

item.title: A look at the preparations behind the JVM port, and a progress update
item.description: If you want your head to spin, read the about the dessign work of Jonathan Worthington. In a related note and much more down to earth, Nicholas Clark reported that 'NQP JVM prototype faster than Perl 5'. (Search for his e-mail, if interested.)

item.title: Call for speakers - Cluj.PM Anniversary Meet-Up
item.description: The one year anniversary meeting of Cluj.pm is planned to be in March.

item.title: New edition of the Advanced Perl Maven e-book was published
item.description: I've updated and released the edition of the Advanced Perl book. People who already purchased (or who attended my advanced course) can download it free.

item.title: Israeli Perl-Workshop 2013 (ILPW)
item.description: February 25, 2013, Tel Aviv, Israel

item.title: German Perl-Workshop 2013
item.description: March 13-15, 2013, Berlin, Germany

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland

item.title: YAPC::NA 2013
item.description: June 3-5, 2013, Austin, Texas, USA
